title: 108_hr3514
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 is the short title of this Act. The table of contents for this Act is provided. The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, through sale or exchange. This includes specific tracts such as US Tract 121 and US Tract 896, as well as US Tract 1047. US Tract 896 is an undeveloped administrative site of 2.42 acres. US Tract 1047, formerly Tracts 551, 551a,b,c, is the original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters spanning 4.90 acres. US Tract 844 is the Marienville ranger residence. US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence, depicted on the map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936", excluding Lot 2 on the Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller in 1999, subject to conveyance under section 5. Maps are the primary descriptions of the lands, with the map being the definitive description unless it cannot be located. The maps are the primary descriptions of the lands, and in case of conflict, the map is deemed the definitive description unless it cannot be located. The maps are available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Consideration for land conveyance may involve the recipient conveying land with the consent of the Secretary. Consideration for land conveyance under this section includes the recipient being able to convey other land or improvements to the Secretary. The Secretary may also accept a cash payment exceeding 25% of the land value in exchange. Applicable law applies unless stated otherwise in this section. The Secretary may accept a cash payment exceeding 25% of the land value in exchange for land conveyance under this section. The conveyance of land is subject to applicable laws and regulations, with a preference given to public entities using the land for public purposes. (e) Solicitation of Offers. The Secretary may prioritize public entities for land conveyance under this section if they agree to use the land for public purposes. Offers can be solicited with terms and conditions set by the Secretary, who can reject any offer deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. The Secretary has the authority to reject offers that are deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. Upon land conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. The Secretary can impose additional terms and conditions to protect the interests of the United States. The Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania will be conveyed according to Section 3. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The Warren County Development Association will make a lump sum payment of $100,000 to the Secretary for US Tract 770. The map serves as the primary description of the lands, and in case of conflict, the map prevails unless it cannot be located. The map will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. The map will be available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 4. CONVEYANCE OF RIDGEWAY RANGER DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS, ELK COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for a fair market value determined by an appraisal. Ridgeway Township must pay the Secretary the fair market value for the conveyed lands as determined by an acceptable appraisal. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands, with conflicts resolved in favor of the map description unless the map is unavailable. In case of conflict between map and metes and bounds descriptions, the map is the definitive description unless it cannot be found. Maps are available for public inspection until lands are disposed of. Upon land conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. SEC. 5. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence, identified as Lot 2 on a Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller in 1999. The map is the primary description of the lands being conveyed. The Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999, serves as the primary description of the lands being conveyed. In case of a conflict with the metes and bounds description, the map prevails unless it cannot be located. The map is available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. On conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from any form of appropriation under the public land laws is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges under section 2, as well as consideration received under sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites for the Allegheny National Forest, or for acquiring land and interests in land. The Sisk Act Fund receives proceeds from sales and exchanges for the Allegheny National Forest. Funds can be used for acquiring administrative facilities, sites, land, and interests in land. Land acquisition in the forest is limited to not exceeding 125% of the market value of lands disposed of under the Act. SEC. 7. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under section 6(b) or by exchange under section 2 shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws pertaining to National Forest System lands. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act shall not be subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code.
